data.title: Hikes in UNESCO Biosphere Entlebuch
data.meta_description: The most beautiful hiking trails UNESCO Biosphere Entlebuch › Plan, track and save hikes & walks ✓ Digital trails maps ✓ incl. app for routes ➤ Try it now!
data.text:
Located in Switzerland, the UNESCO Biosphere Entlebuch is a paradise for nature lovers and outdoor enthusiasts. This region is characterized by its stunning landscapes, which include lush meadows, dense forests, sparkling lakes, and majestic mountains.

Hiking Routes

The UNESCO Biosphere Entlebuch boasts an extensive network of well-maintained hiking trails that cater to different preferences and abilities. Whether you are an experienced hiker or exploring with kids, there are plenty of options to choose from.

1. Schrattenfluh Panorama Trail

This popular hike takes you on a journey through picturesque alpine scenery. The trail offers breathtaking panoramic views of the surrounding mountains and valleys as you make your way up to Schrattenfluh peak.

2. Moorland Adventure Loop

If you're looking for something more unique, the Moorland Adventure Loop is perfect for immersing yourself in the pristine beauty of peatlands. This circular route allows you to explore fascinating flora and fauna while learning about the importance of wetland conservation.

3. Glaubenbielen Pass Hike

The Glaubenbielen Pass Hike is ideal for those seeking a moderate challenge combined with captivating natural surroundings. As you ascend towards Glaubenbielen Pass, be prepared to encounter charming alpine farms dotting the landscape along with stunning vistas.

Best Seasons

The best time to hike in UNESCO Biosphere Entlebuch is during the spring and summer months, from May to September. During this period, the weather is generally pleasant with mild temperatures and longer daylight hours.

Hiking Tours

If you prefer guided hiking tours, there are several options available in UNESCO Biosphere Entlebuch. Experienced local guides can lead you through the most scenic routes while providing insights into the region's rich natural and cultural heritage.

1. Alpine Flora Tour

This tour focuses on exploring the diverse alpine flora found in the region. You'll have the opportunity to discover rare plant species and learn about their ecological significance from knowledgeable guides.

2. Wildlife Discovery Tour

Embark on a wildlife discovery tour where you can observe native animals such as ibexes, chamois, golden eagles, and more in their natural habitat. Expert guides will share interesting facts about these fascinating creatures along the way.
